title: Portfolio (This Website)
projectDescription: This portfolio site was built from scratch to showcase my previous work and design skills as a web developer.
projectKeynotes:
• Built using Angular 9
  • Makes use of JSON, jQuery, Bootstrap & Angular Material libraries
  • Makes use of Angular declarations, interpolation, components, dependencies, and many other key aspects of the Angular framework

title: Residential Electric
projectDescription: This website was designed for an HVAC company, following their direct requests for site functionality.
projectKeynotes:
• Created using the WordPress CMS
  • Worked closely with client to evaluate and implement requested features
  • Employed iterative design practices to update the website based on the needs of the client

title: DaytonaState InMotion News
projectDescription: During my time at Daytona State College, I assisted the college newspaper with their website as resident Webmaster for 2 years.
projectKeynotes:
• Created using the WordPress CMS
  • Collaborated with staff members to provide content for the site
  • Attended weekly meetings with staff to discuss website content and features
  • Managed user accounts, employing best cybersecurity practices to avoid any stolen accounts or information
  • Maintained and updated legacy systems put in place by previous Webmasters

title: Bideojames
projectDescription: For a brief period, I assisted a team of video game journalists with designing and running a gaming news website. The project is now on hiatus, but the site is still up as another valuable portfolio example.
projectKeynotes:
• Created using the WordPress CMS
  • Collaborated with staff members to provide content for the site

title: Haxan Future
projectDescription: This site serves as the host for any creative productions I make under the pseudonym “Haxan Future”.
projectKeynotes:
• Created using Angular, Bootstrap, Angular Materials, and JQuery
  • Currently not mobile-friendly, will be updated in the near future

title: Web Systems Course Website
projectDescription: This site serves as a host for projects completed during my time in COP4813 – Web Systems. This site serves as a display of my abilities with multiple fundamental aspects of web development.
projectKeynotes:
• Created from scratch using HTML, CSS and JavaScript
  • Makes use of concepts like form validation, canvas animation, JSON parsing, and multimedia development using the Phaser 3 JavaScript game engine

title: EG3343 Thermodynamics Content Hosting
projectDescription: This project was completed with a team of two other developers to assist a professor with creating a website to host course materials for EG3343 students to visit.
projectKeynotes:
• Created using the WordPress CMS
  • Strong practice in collaborating with other developers to meet a client’s needs
